p: Forty-one samples of S. rosmarinus collected in different locations of Sicily were analysed by Napoli et al. [ 32]. Monoterpenes, both hydrocarbons (range of 21–68%) and oxygenated (range of 29–79%), were the most highly represented components. Three essential oils obtained from aerial parts of S. rosmarinus growing in Tunisia were analysed with detection of 38 components. Among them, 1,8-cineole and camphor were found in more content (33.08–37.75% and 13.55–18.13%, respectively) than our essential oils, but similar values for α-pinene (8.58–9.32%), α-terpineol (6.79–8.17%), camphene (5.07–5.58%), and borneol (4.08–5.48%) were observed [ 33].
